title: Calories in Swordfish
meta_description: Discover calories in swordfish per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
assumptions: Cooked swordfish steak, dry heat (broiled), no added oil or seasonings; skinless.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish size, freshness, cooking method, and source; mercury levels can be high—check advisories. Consult labels or databases for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked swordfish provides ~211 kcal and ~23 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged seafood.

tweaks.label: Grilled with 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Baked with lemon and herbs (no added fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g swordfish?
faqs.a: About 211 kcal for cooked swordfish per 100 g.
Yes, ~23.5 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean seafood option.

faqs.q: What about fat content in swordfish calories?
faqs.a: Around 12.2 g total fat per 100 g, mostly healthy omega-3s.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect swordfish calories?
faqs.a: Dry heat like broiling keeps it at ~211 kcal/100 g; frying or oil adds more.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars—it's a zero-carb protein source.
